intro: Riedelia affinis, commonly known as the Mexican violet, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. It has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soil with partial to full sun. Riedelia affinis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
